borough: London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
site_name: The Gateway SiteWhite City Place201 Wood LaneLondonW12
description: Variation of Conditions 6 (Drawings) and 9 (Gross External Floorspace/Land Uses) to allow minor material amendments to hybrid planning permission (ref: 2016/04452/COMB) dated 26 March 2018 and S73 variation permission (ref: 2019/03144/VAR) dated 18 March 2021, related to Gateway East (GWE) and in respect to:"Demolition of existing car park and temporary public open space to facilitate comprehensive phased redevelopment of the site, to erect: three buildings to provide Office (Class B1); Retail (Class A1), and Restaurant (Class A3) floorspace; hard and soft landscaping works, and alterations to existing vehicular/pedestrian routes/ access and associated works. Planning Permission is sought in detail for the erection of a building (GWE) with 1 basement level, comprising Office (Class B1); Retail (Class A1), and Restaurant (Class A3); hard and soft landscaping areas, and; alterations to existing vehicular/pedestrian routes/ access and associated works. Planning Permission (with all matters to be reserved) is sought for the erection of two other buildings (GWW, GWC) with 1 basement level; hard and soft landscaping areas, and; alterations to existing vehicular/pedestrian routes/access and associated works".Proposed minor material amendments to Gateway East (GWE): A minor increase in the Gross External Floorspace (GEA); Rationalisation of the basement footprint, including an increase in the quantum of cycle parking; Amendments to the ground floor layout, including relocation of the community space from the top floor and introduction of new town hall style community space at ground level; Amendments to Levels 7-14, to provide lab-enabled floorspace for life science use; Improvements to carbon efficiency and the introduction of enhanced sustainability measures, including on floor air handling plant and air source heat pumps; Amendments to the facade design and building frame; and Improvements to the landscaping and public realm, including enhanced urban greening.
